What do any of you guys use to burn .mkv files to dvd? I've tried allot of different programs to convert the files and to burn them to dvd's and for some reason or another they never work.  I have no problem burning .avi files, but no matter what I try, I can't seem to have any luck with .mkv files. Any help would be greatly appreciated.  Thank you very much in advance.
Correction,  I can burn them to a dvd disc, but the format isn't compatible on the dvd player or xbox360.  Can someone help me out with this. Thanks.

@rcr29budcar - 

1.A DVD player is totally different technology to a BluRay player.

2.These are HDMI output files so ditto (above.)

You could only hook up a Popcorn Hour or similar to play any files above 4GB (that is the limit of your XBox 360 file size thus ditto (above.)

Simply put-get a Popcorn Hour or later and spend some cash getting good equipment (a good TV/Home Cinema Amp etc.)

I just spent the last three days dl the torrent and when I look at the files after it says the torrent is complete but only the samples have actually downloaded?  The .mkv files that contain the actual movie appear to be empty at 0bytes ... what have I done wrong?  Sorry if this is a noob question but I'm really worried about all the bandwidth I just wasted!

@kon_klink - You clearly only downloaded the sample files and skipped the actual fims. I never dl the .nfo, smaple or anything EXCEPT the film files (why waste the electric/hd space/bandwidth?)

You had better go into your downloded file folder (whilst downloading on your torrent engine) e.g. in utorrent click on the torrent, go to "files" on the lower toolbar and then, at the far right it states "priority"-left click it with your mouse and it'll show options- you chose "skip" so now change that to "normal priority" and you will see the film start downloading (again.) Do this for all the films and wait a week-you'll have them all then.

By the way, did you not wonder why you upped them all in a day and the files were only showing about 100 Megabytes file size?

Doh!
sic-"sample" not "smaple"

sic-"sample" not "smaple"

The Doh! must be infectious. By the way kon_klink-if it took you 3 days to dl 300mbs, you will have the films in 358 days (35,880 Megabytes divided by 33 Megabytes a day) before you will watch this-the next version will be out by then!

Correction: I mistook the 100 Mbs for the 33 a day-it will thus be 1,087 days and 6 hours before you watch them-or just shy of 3 years.

I downloaded Episode III from this torrent first, it took over a week as the file was over 12GB. When I finished downloading it, I went to play it and the file was empty. The sample downloaded but the actual movie file had zero bytes size. So thinking something went wrong, I deleted the file (note, when I deleted it asked me if it could delete it permanently as the file was too big, as though there actually was 12GB in the folder) 

I then downloaded the entire torrent, all 35GB of it, and got the same issue. All the samples are there, but the actual .mkv movie files all show as having zero bytes filesize. 

I download a lot of torrents and I've never encountered this issue before. Anyone know what's up??

I see from the comments that someone else had this same issue with this torrent as well.

@wengy78

this is because of the long file names. try copying the downloaded root directory of this torrent to any location. it should copy the files like starwa~1.mkv etc. it worked for me.
